intro: Jarandersonia pentaceoides, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a striking flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, golden-yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features a thick, upright stem with alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its unique inflorescence consists of a central disk surrounded by ray florets, creating a cup-like appearance. Jarandersonia pentaceoides thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
